general_advisory: As there is a chance of occurrence of light to moderate rainfall along with heavy rainfall in one or two places in upcoming days, farmers are advised to avoid irrigation as well as spraying operation during that period and should wait some days for transplanting of rice and planting of fruit and vegetable crops. Looking to the high wind speed condition, make provision to support the crops.

advisory: Nursery sowing should be completed by end of 2nd fortnight of July. Keep 3 pheromone traps/acre of rice nursery for monitoring the stem borer and leaf folder infestation.

Main field land preparation should be done by puddling the field twice at 7-10 days intervals and land leveling for uniform crop stand. About 0.8t/acre of well decomposed FYM may be applied before first puddling.

The ideal sowing time is June 20 to end of July for kharif maize. Before sowing, seeds should be treated with fungicides and insecticides to protect them from seed and soil borne diseases and some insect-pests.
Farmers should start raised bed nursery preparation for kharif vegetable crops with proper drainage system to avoid water logging.
Deworming and vaccination of animals against infectious diseases should be ensured. Animal should be kept at safe places in shed and avoid mixing of flowing rain water into source of drinking water.
